featured.text: None of them wanted to—though for some years afterwards I was left in no doubt that I was morally obliged to them, in the sense that it always seemed to be my round when it came to the buying of drinks.

definition.zh_def: 使某人有義務或責任去做某事
definition.en_def: To make someone feel morally or legally bound to do something.
definition.example: The company was obliged to provide safety equipment for all employees.
